div1.head: Introduction
div1.p: This document describes the namespace &nsname; defined by the specification (&upd.spec.date.month; &upd.spec.date.year; version). This namespace is typically identified by the namespace prefix xqxuf:, which is not a predefined prefix. For updated information, please refer to the latest version of the specification.
This document contains a directory of links to related resources, using RDDL (as defined in ).
It is GRDDL-enabled (as defined in ), that is to say that a GRDDL-compliant processor can extract useful RDF (as defined in ) representations of the information contained herein.

div1.head: XML Schemas
div1.p:
There are two syntaxes in which queries can be written. One is the so-called human-readable syntax defined by
as an extension to the syntax defined in , while the other is an XML syntax for XQuery defined by
as an extension to the XML vocabulary defined in .
XQueryX, as defined in is specified in the namespace http://www.w3.org/2005/XQueryX, which is defined by an XML Schema.

rddl:resource.xlink:title: XML Schema for validation of the XML Syntax for XQuery
rddl:resource.p: This schema specifies the XML syntax of the XQuery expressions defined in . It is located at http://www.w3.org/&xqx.spec.date.year;/&xqx.spec.date.MM;/XQueryX/xqueryx.xsd.

div1.p:
The XML syntax defined in
is specified in the namespace http://www.w3.org/2007/xquery-update, which extends the XML vocabulary defined in the namespace http://www.w3.org/2005/XQueryX. It is defined by a pair of XML Schemas.

rddl:resource.xlink:title: XML Schema for validation of the XML syntax for XQuery Update expressions
rddl:resource.p: The first of those two schemata specifies the XML syntax of the XQuery Update expressions defined in . It is located at http://www.w3.org/&upd.spec.date.year;/&upd.spec.date.MM;/xquery-update/xquery-update-30-xqueryx.xsd.

rddl:resource.xlink:title: XML Schema to redefine components of the base XQueryX schema
rddl:resource.p: The second of those two schemata redefines components of the XML Schema defined in as needed by the syntax defined in . It is located at http://www.w3.org/&upd.spec.date.year;/&upd.spec.date.MM;/xquery-update/xquery-update-30-xqueryx-redef.xsd.

div1.p: XQuery Update Facility 3.0 queries written using the XML syntax must be valid according to those two schemas. Validation must be performed as defined by , using strict validation, full validation attempted, using the <xqx:module> element as the validation root. The result of that validation must not be invalid or notKnown.

rddl:resource.xlink:title: XSLT stylesheet for transformation into human-readable XQuery syntax
rddl:resource.p: Queries written using the XML syntax of have semantics that are defined by the XQuery "human-readable" syntax that results from transforming those XML syntax queries using the stylesheet located at http://www.w3.org/&xqx.spec.date.year;/&xqx.spec.date.MM;/XQueryX/xqueryx.xsl.

rddl:resource.xlink:title: XSLT stylesheet for transformation into human-readable XQuery Update syntax
rddl:resource.p: Queries written using the XML syntax of have semantics that are defined by the XQuery "human-readable" syntax that results from transforming those XML syntax queries using the stylesheet located at http://www.w3.org/&upd.spec.date.year;/&upd.spec.date.MM;/xquery-update/xquery-update-30-xqueryx.xsl. This stylesheet extends the stylesheet defined in that is located at http://www.w3.org/&xqx.spec.date.year;/&xqx.spec.date.MM;/XQueryX/xqueryx.xsl.
